\section{Page (lv\_page)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:page-lv-page}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:overview}}
The Page consist of two {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/cont::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Containers}}}} on each other:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
a \sphinxstylestrong{background}

\item {} 
a top which is \sphinxstylestrong{scrollable}.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:parts-and-styles}}
The Page's main part is called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_PAGE\_PART\_BG}} which is the background of the Page. It uses all the typical background style properties. Using padding will add space on the sides.

The scrollable object can be referenced via the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_PAGE\_PART\_SCRL}} part. It also uses all the typical background style properties and padding to add space on the sides.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LIST\_PART\_SCROLLBAR}} is a virtual part of the background to draw the scroll bars. Uses all the typical background style properties, \sphinxstyleemphasis{size} to set the width of the scroll bars, and \sphinxstyleemphasis{pad\_right} and \sphinxstyleemphasis{pad\_bottom} to set the spacing.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LIST\_PART\_EDGE\_FLASH}}is also a virtual part of the background to draw a semicircle on the sides when the list can not be scrolled in that direction further. Uses all the typical background properties.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:usage}}
The background object can be referenced as the page itself like. E.g. to set the page's width: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_set\_width(page, 100)}}.

If a child is created on the page it will be automatically moved to the scrollable container.
If the scrollable container becomes larger then the background it can be scrolled by dragging (like the lists on smartphones).

By default, the scrollable's has \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_FIT\_MAX}} fit in all directions.
It means the scrollable size will be the same as the background's size (minus the padding) while the children are in the background.
But when an object is positioned out of the background the scrollable size will be increased to involve it.


\subsubsection{Scrollbars}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:scrollbars}}
Scrollbars can be shown according to four policies:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SCRLBAR\_MODE\_OFF}} Never show scroll bars

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SCRLBAR\_MODE\_ON}} Always show scroll bars

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SCRLBAR\_MODE\_DRAG}} Show scroll bars when the page is being dragged

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SCRLBAR\_MODE\_AUTO}} Show scroll bars when the scrollable container is large enough to be scrolled

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SCRLBAR\_MODE\_HIDE}} Hide the scroll bar temporally

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SCRLBAR\_MODE\_UNHIDE}}  Unhide the previously hidden scrollbar. Recover the original mode too

\end{itemize}

The scroll bar show policy can be changed by: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrlbar\_mode(page, SB\_MODE)}}. The default value is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SCRLBAR\_MODE\_AUTO}}.


\subsubsection{Glue object}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:glue-object}}
A children can be "glued" to the page. In this case, if the page can be scrolled by dragging that object.
It can be enabled by the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_glue\_obj(child, true)}}.


\subsubsection{Focus object}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:focus-object}}
An object on a page can be focused with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_focus(page, child, LV\_ANIM\_ONO/FF)}}.
It will move the scrollable container to show a child. The time of the animation can be set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_anim\_time(page, anim\_time)}} in milliseconds.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{child}} doesn't have to be a direct child of the page. This is it works if the scrollable object is the grandparent of the object too.


\subsubsection{Manual navigation}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:manual-navigation}}
You can move the scrollable object manually using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_scroll\_hor(page, dist)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_scroll\_ver(page, dist)}}


\subsubsection{Edge flash}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:edge-flash}}
A circle-like effect can be shown if the list reached the most top/bottom/left/right position. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_edge\_flash(list, en)}} enables this feature.


\subsubsection{Scroll propagation}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:scroll-propagation}}
If the list is created on an other scrollable element (like an other page) and the Page can't be scrolled further the scrolling can be propagated to the parent to continue the scrolling on the parent.
It can be enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scroll\_propagation(list, true)}}


\subsection{Clean the page}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:clean-the-page}}
All the object created on the page can be clean with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_clean(page)}}. Note that \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_obj\_clean(page)}} doesn't work here because it would delete the scrollable object too.


\subsubsection{Scrollable API}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:scrollable-api}}
There are functions to directly set/get the scrollable's attributes:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_get\_scrl()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_fit/fint2/fit4()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_width()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_height()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_fit\_width()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_fit\_height()}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scrl\_layout()}}

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.

The scrollable object has a default event callback which propagates the following events to the background object:
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESSED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESSING}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_PRESS\_LOST}},\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_RELEASED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_SHORT\_CLICKED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_CLICKED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_LONG\_PRESSED}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_LONG\_PRESSED\_REPEAT}}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.

\#\#Keys

The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Page:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/LEFT/UP/DOWN} Scroll the page

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\subsection{Example}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/page:example}}

\section{Roller (lv\_roller)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:roller-lv-roller}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:overview}}
Roller allows you to simply select one option from more with scrolling.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:parts-and-styles}}
The Roller's main part is called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_ROLLER\_PART\_BG}}. It's a rectangle and uses all the typical background properties.
The style of the Roller's label is inherited from the \sphinxstyleemphasis{text} style properties of the background.
To adjust the space between the options use the \sphinxstyleemphasis{text\_line\_space} style property.
The \sphinxstyleemphasis{padding} style properties set the space on the sides.

The selected option in the middle can be referenced with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_ROLLER\_PART\_SELECTED}} virtual part. It also uses all the typical background properties and \sphinxstyleemphasis{text\_color} property to change the color of the options in the selected area.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:usage}}

\subsubsection{Set options}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:set-options}}
The options are passed to the Roller as a string with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_options(roller, options, LV\_ROLLER\_MODE\_NORMAL/INFINITE)}}. The options should be separated by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textbackslash{}n}}. For example: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"First\textbackslash{}nSecond\textbackslash{}nThird"}}.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_ROLLER\_MODE\_INIFINITE}} make the roller circular.

You can select an option manually with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_selected(roller, id, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}, where \sphinxstyleemphasis{id} is the index of an option.


\subsubsection{Get selected option}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:get-selected-option}}
The get the currently selected option use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_get\_selected(roller)}} it will return the \sphinxstyleemphasis{index} of the selected option.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_get\_selected\_str(roller, buf, buf\_size)}} copy the name of the selected option to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{buf}}.


\subsubsection{Align the options}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:align-the-options}}
To align the label horizontally use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_align(roller, LV\_LABEL\_ALIGN\_LEFT/CENTER/RIGHT)}}.


\subsubsection{Visible rows}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:visible-rows}}
The number of visible rows can be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_visible\_row\_count(roller, num)}}


\subsubsection{Animation time}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:animation-time}}
When the Roller is scrolled and doesn't stop exactly on an option it will scroll to the nearest valid option automatically.
The time of this scroll animation can be changed by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_roller\_set\_anim\_time(roller, anim\_time)}}. Zero animation time means no animation.


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:events}}
Besides, the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Drop down lists:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} sent when a new option is selected

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:keys}}
The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Buttons:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/DOWN} Select the next option

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT/UP} Select the previous option

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LY\_KEY\_ENTER} Apply the selected option (Send \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED}} event)

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Example}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:example}}

\subsubsection{C}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:c}}

\label{\detokenize{widgets/roller:simple-roller}}

\section{Slider (lv\_slider)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:slider-lv-slider}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:overview}}
The Slider object looks like a {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/bar::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Bar}}}} supplemented with a knob. The knob can be dragged to set a value. The Slider also can be vertical or horizontal.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:parts-and-styles}}
The Slider's main part is called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SLIDER\_PART\_BG}} and it uses the typical background style properties.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SLIDER\_PART\_INDIC}} is a virtual part which also uses all the typical background properties.
By default, the indicator maximal size is the same as the background's size but setting positive padding values in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SLIDER\_PART\_BG}} will make the indicator smaller. (negative values will make it larger)
If the \sphinxstyleemphasis{value} style property is used on the indicator the alignment will be calculated based on the current size of the indicator.
For example a center aligned value is always shown in the middle of the indicator regardless it's current size.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SLIDER\_PART\_KNOB}} is a virtual part using all the typical background properties to describe the knob(s). Similarly to the \sphinxstyleemphasis{indicator} the \sphinxstyleemphasis{value} text is also aligned to the current position and size of the knob.
By default the knob is square (with a radius) with side length equal to the smaller side of the slider. The knob can be made larger with the \sphinxstyleemphasis{padding} values. Padding values can be asymmetric too.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:usage}}

\subsubsection{Value and range}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:value-and-range}}
To set an initial value use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set\_value(slider, new\_value, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set\_anim\_time(slider, anim\_time)}} sets the animation time in milliseconds.

To specify the range (min, max values) the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set\_range(slider, min , max)}} can be used.


\subsubsection{Symmetrical and Range}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:symmetrical-and-range}}
Besides the normal type the Slider can be configured in two additional types:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SLIDER\_TYPE\_NORMAL}} normal type

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SLIDER\_TYPE\_SYMMETRICAL}} draw the indicator symmetrical to zero (drawn from zero, left to right)

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SLIDER\_TYPE\_RANGE}} allow the use of an additional knob for the left (start) value. (Can be used with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set/get\_left\_value()}})

\end{itemize}

The type can be changed with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_set\_type(slider, LV\_SLIDER\_TYPE\_...)}}


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Slider:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} Sent while the slider is being dragged or changed with keys. The event is sent continuously while the slider is dragged and only when it is released. Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_slider\_is\_dragged}} to decide whether is slider is being dragged or just released.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:keys}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_UP}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT} Increment the slider's value by 1

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_DOWN}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT} Decrement the slider's value by 1

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\subsection{Example}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:example}}

\subsubsection{C}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/slider:c}}

\section{Spinbox (lv\_spinbox)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinbox:spinbox-lv-spinbox}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinbox::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinbox:overview}}
The Spinbox contains a number as text which can be increased or decreased by \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} or API functions.
Under the hood the Spinbox is a modified {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/textarea::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Text area}}}}.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinbox:parts-and-styles}}
The Spinbox's main part is called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SPINBOX\_PART\_BG}} which is a rectangle-like background using all the typical background style properties. It also describes the style of the label with its \sphinxstyleemphasis{text} style properties.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SPINBOX\_PART\_CURSOR}} is a virtual part describing the cursor. Read the {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/textarea::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Text area}}}} documentation for a detailed description.


\subsubsection{Set format}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinbox:set-format}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_digit\_format(spinbox, digit\_count, separator\_position)}} set the format of the number.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{digit\_count}} sets the number of digits. Leading zeros are added to fill the space on the left.
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{separator\_position}} sets the number of digit before the decimal point. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} means no decimal point.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_padding\_left(spinbox, cnt)}} add \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{cnt}} "space" characters between the sign an the most left digit.


\subsubsection{Value and ranges}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinbox:value-and-ranges}}
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_range(spinbox, min, max)}} sets the range of the Spinbox.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_value(spinbox, num)}} sets the Spinbox's value manually.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_increment(spinbox)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_decrement(spinbox)}} increments/decrements the value of the Spinbox.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinbox\_set\_step(spinbox, step)}} sets the amount to increment decrement.


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinbox:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Drop down lists:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} sent when the value has changed. (the value is set as event data as \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{int32\_t}})

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_INSERT} sent by the ancestor Text area but shouldn't be used.

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinbox:keys}}
The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Buttons:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT/RIGHT} With \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keypad} move the cursor left/right. With \sphinxstyleemphasis{Encoder} decrement/increment the selected digit.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LY\_KEY\_ENTER} Apply the selected option (Send \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED}} event and close the Drop down list)

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_ENTER} With \sphinxstyleemphasis{Encoder} got the net digit. Jump to the first after the last.

\end{itemize}

\section{Spinner (lv\_spinner)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:spinner-lv-spinner}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:overview}}
The Spinner object is a spinning arc over a border.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:parts-and-styles}}
The Spinner uses the the following parts:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SPINNER\_PART\_BG}}: main part

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SPINNER\_PART\_INDIC}}: the spinning arc (virtual part)

\end{itemize}

The parts and style works the same as in case of {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/arc::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Arc}}}}. Read its documentation for a details description.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:usage}}

\subsubsection{Arc length}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:arc-length}}
The length of the arc can be adjusted by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinner\_set\_arc\_length(spinner, deg)}}.


\subsubsection{Spinning speed}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:spinning-speed}}
The speed of the spinning can be adjusted by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinner\_set\_spin\_time(preload, time\_ms)}}.


\subsubsection{Spin types}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:spin-types}}
You can choose from more spin types:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SPINNER\_TYPE\_SPINNING\_ARC} spin the arc, slow down on the top

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SPINNER\_TYPE\_FILLSPIN\_ARC} spin the arc, slow down on the top but also stretch the arc

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_SPINNER\_TYPE\_CONSTANT\_ARC} spin the arc at a constant speed

\end{itemize}

To apply one if them use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinner\_set\_type(preload, LV\_SPINNER\_TYPE\_...)}}


\subsubsection{Spin direction}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:spin-direction}}
The direction of spinning can be changed with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_spinner\_set\_dir(preload, LV\_SPINNER\_DIR\_FORWARD/BACKWARD)}}.


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:keys}}
No \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\subsection{Example}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/spinner:example}}

\section{Switch (lv\_switch)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:switch-lv-switch}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:overview}}
The Switch can be used to turn on/off something. It looks like a little slider.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:parts-and-styles}}
The Switch uses the the following parts:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SWITCH\_PART\_BG}}: main part

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SWITCH\_PART\_INDIC}}: the indicator (virtual part)

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_SWITCH\_PART\_KNOB}}: the knob (virtual part)

\end{itemize}

The parts and style works the same as in case of {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/slider::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Slider}}}}. Read its documentation for a details description.

\#\#Usage


\subsubsection{Change state}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:change-state}}
The state of the Switch can be changed by clicking on it or by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_switch\_on(switch, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_switch\_off(switch, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_switch\_toggle(switch, LV\_ANOM\_ON/OFF)}} functions


\subsubsection{Animation time}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:animation-time}}
The time of animations, when the switch changes state, can be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_switch\_set\_anim\_time(switch, anim\_time)}}.


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Switch:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} Sent when the switch changes state.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:keys}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_UP}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT} Turn on the slider

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_DOWN}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT} Turn off the slider

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\subsection{Example}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:example}}

\subsubsection{C}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:c}}

\paragraph{Simple Switch}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/switch:simple-switch}}
\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics{{lv_ex_switch_1}.png}

\section{Table (lv\_table)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:table-lv-table}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/table::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:overview}}
Tables, as usual, are built from rows, columns, and cells containing texts.

The Table object is very light weighted because only the texts are stored. No real objects are created for cells but they are just drawn on the fly.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:parts-and-styles}}
The main part of the Table is called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABLE\_PART\_BG}}. It's a rectangle like background and uses all the typical background style properties.

For the cells there are 4 virtual parts. Every cell has type (1, 2, 3 or 4) which tells which part's styles to apply on them. The cell parts are:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABLE\_PART\_CELL1}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABLE\_PART\_CELL2}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABLE\_PART\_CELL3}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABLE\_PART\_CELL4}}

\end{itemize}

The cells also use all the typical background style properties. If there is a line break (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\textbackslash{}n}}) in a cell's content then a horizontal division line will drawn after the line break using the \sphinxstyleemphasis{line} style properties.

The style of texts in the cells are inherited from the cell parts or the background part.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:usage}}

\subsubsection{Rows and Columns}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:rows-and-columns}}
To set number of rows and columns use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_row\_cnt(table, row\_cnt)}} and \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_col\_cnt(table, col\_cnt)}}


\subsubsection{Width and Height}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:width-and-height}}
The width of the columns can be set with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_col\_width(table, col\_id, width)}}. The overall width of the Table object will be set to the sum of columns widths.

The height is calculated automatically from the cell styles (font, padding etc) and the number of rows.


\subsubsection{Set cell value}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:set-cell-value}}
The cells can store only texts so numbers needs to be converted to text before displaying them in a table.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_value(table, row, col, "Content")}}. The text is saved by the table so it can be even a local variable.

Line break can be used in the text like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{"Value\textbackslash{}n60.3"}}.


\subsubsection{Align}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:align}}
The text alignment in cells can be adjusted individually with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_align(table, row, col, LV\_LABEL\_ALIGN\_LEFT/CENTER/RIGHT)}}.


\subsubsection{Cell type}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:cell-type}}
You can use 4 different cell types. Each has its own style.

Cell types can be used to add different style for example to:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
table header

\item {} 
first column

\item {} 
highlight a cell

\item {} 
etc

\end{itemize}

The type can be selected with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_type(table, row, col, type)}} \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{type}} can be 1, 2, 3 or 4.


\subsubsection{Merge cells}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:merge-cells}}
Cells can be merged horizontally with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_merge\_right(table, col, row, true)}}. To merge more adjacent cells apply this function for each cell.


\subsubsection{Crop text}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:crop-text}}
By default, the texts are word-wrapped to fit into the width of the cell and the height of the cell is set automatically.
To disable this and keep the text as it is enable \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_table\_set\_cell\_crop(table, row, col, true)}}.


\subsubsection{Scroll}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:scroll}}
The make the Table scrollable place it on a {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}}


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:keys}}
No \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\subsection{Example}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:example}}

\subsubsection{C}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:c}}

\paragraph{Simple table}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/table:simple-table}}
\noindent\sphinxincludegraphics{{lv_ex_table_1}.png}

code

\begin{sphinxVerbatim}[commandchars=\\\{\}]
\PYG{c+cp}{\PYGZsh{}}\PYG{c+cp}{include} \PYG{c+cpf}{\PYGZdq{}../../../lv\PYGZus{}examples.h\PYGZdq{}}

\section{Tabview (lv\_tabview)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:tabview-lv-tabview}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:overview}}
The Tab view object can be used to organize content in tabs.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:parts-and-styles}}
The Tab view object has several parts. The main is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_BG}}. It a rectangle-like container which holds the other parts of the Tab view.

On the background 2 important real parts are created:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_BG\_SCRL}}: it's the scrollable part of {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}}. It holds the content of the tabs next to each other. The background of the Page is always transparent and can't be accessed externally.

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_TAB\_BG}}: The tab buttons which is a {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/btnmatrix::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Button matrix}}}}.
Clicking on a button will scroll \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_BG\_SCRL}} to the related tab's content. The tab buttons can be accessed via \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_TAB\_BTN}}.
The height of the tab's button matrix is calculated from the font height plus padding of the background's and the button's style.

\end{itemize}

All the listed parts supports the typical background style properties and padding.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_TAB\_BG}} has an additional real part, an indicator, called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_INDIC}}.
It's a thin rectangle-like object under the currently selected tab. When the tab view is animated to an other tab the indicator will be animated too.
It can be styles using the typical background style properties. The \sphinxstyleemphasis{size} style property will set the its thickness.

When a new tab is added a {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} is create for them on \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_BG\_SCRL}} and a new button is added to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_TAB\_BG}} Button matrix.
The created Pages can be used as normal Pages and they have the usual Page parts.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:usage}}

\subsubsection{Adding tab}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:adding-tab}}
New tabs can be added with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_add\_tab(tabview, "Tab name")}}. It will return with a pointer to a {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} object where the tab's content can be created.


\subsubsection{Change tab}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:change-tab}}
To select a new tab you can:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Click on it on the Button matrix part

\item {} 
Slide

\item {} 
Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_set\_tab\_act(tabview, id, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}} function

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Tab button's position}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:tab-button-s-position}}
By default, the tab selector buttons are placed on the top of the Tab view. It can be changed with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_set\_btns\_pos(tabview, LV\_TABVIEW\_TAB\_POS\_TOP/BOTTOM/LEFT/RIGHT/NONE)}}

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_TAB\_POS\_NONE}} will hide the tabs.

Note that, you can't change the tab position from top or bottom to left or right when tabs are already added.


\subsubsection{Animation time}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:animation-time}}
The animation time is adjusted by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tabview\_set\_anim\_time(tabview, anim\_time\_ms)}}. It is used when the new tab is loaded.


\subsubsection{Scroll propagation}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:scroll-propagation}}
As the tabs' content object is a Page it can receive scroll propagation from an other Page-like object.
For example, if a text area is created on the tab's content and that Text area is scrolled but it reached the end the scroll can be propagated to the content Page.
It can be enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page/textarea\_set\_scroll\_propagation(obj, true)}}.

By default the tab's content Pages have enabled scroll propagation, therefore when they are scrolled horizontally the scroll is propagated to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TABVIEW\_PART\_BG\_SCRL}} and this way the Pages will be scrolled.

The manual sliding can be disabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_page\_set\_scroll\_propagation(tab\_page, false)}}.


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Slider:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} Sent when a new tab is selected by sliding or clicking the tab button

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tabview:keys}}
The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Tabview:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/LEFT} Select a tab

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_ENTER} Change to the selected tab

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.

\section{Text area (lv\_textarea)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:text-area-lv-textarea}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:overview}}
The Text Area is a {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} with a {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/label::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Label}}}} and a cursor on it.
Texts or characters can be added to it.
Long lines are wrapped and when the text becomes long enough the Text area can be scrolled.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:parts-and-styles}}
The Text area has the same parts as {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}}.
Expect \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_PAGE\_PART\_SCRL}} because it can't be referenced and it's always transparent.
Refer the Page's documentation of details.

Besides the Page parts the virtual \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TEXTAREA\_PART\_CURSOR}} part exists to draw the cursor.
The cursor's area is always the bounding box of the current character.
A block cursor can be created by adding a background color and background opa to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TEXTAREA\_PART\_CURSOR}}'s style.
The create line cursor let the cursor transparent and set the \sphinxstyleemphasis{border\_side} property.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:usage}}

\subsubsection{Add text}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:add-text}}
You can insert text or characters  to the current cursor's position with:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_add\_char(textarea, 'c')}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_add\_text(textarea, "insert this text")}}

\end{itemize}

To add wide characters like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{'á'}}, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{'ß'}} or CJK characters use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_add\_text(ta, "á")}}.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_text(ta, "New text")}} changes the whole text.


\subsubsection{Placeholder}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:placeholder}}
A placeholder text can be specified - which is displayed when the Text area is empty - with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_placeholder\_text(ta, "Placeholder text")}}


\subsubsection{Delete character}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:delete-character}}
To delete a character from the left of the current cursor position use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_del\_char(textarea)}}.
To delete from the right use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_del\_char\_forward(textarea)}}


\subsubsection{Move the cursor}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:move-the-cursor}}
The cursor position can be modified directly with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_cursor\_pos(textarea, 10)}}.
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0}} position means "before the first characters",
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_TA\_CURSOR\_LAST}} means "after the last character"

You can step the cursor with
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_cursor\_right(textarea)}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_cursor\_left(textarea)}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_cursor\_up(textarea)}}

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_cursor\_down(textarea)}}

\end{itemize}

If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_cursor\_click\_pos(textarea, true)}} is called the cursor will jump to the position where the Text area was clicked.


\subsubsection{Hide the cursor}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:hide-the-cursor}}
The cursor can be hidden with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_cursor\_hidden(textarea, true)}}.


\subsubsection{Cursor blink time}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:cursor-blink-time}}
The blink time of the cursor can be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_cursor\_blink\_time(textarea, time\_ms)}}.


\subsubsection{One line mode}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:one-line-mode}}
The Text area can be configures to be one lined with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_one\_line(ta, true)}}.
In this mode the height is set automatically to show only one line, line break character are ignored, and word wrap is disabled.


\subsubsection{Password mode}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:password-mode}}
The text area supports password mode which can be enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_pwd\_mode(textarea, true)}}.

If the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{•}} (\sphinxhref{http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/2022/index.htm}{Bullet, U+2022}) character exists in the font, the entered characters are converted to it after some time or when a new character is entered.
If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{•}} not exists, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{*}} will be used.

In password mode \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_get\_text(textarea)}} gives the real text, not the bullet characters.

The visibility time can be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_pwd\_show\_time(textarea, time\_ms)}}.


\subsubsection{Text align}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:text-align}}
The text can be aligned to the left, center or right with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_text\_align(textarea, LV\_LABEL\_ALIGN\_LET/CENTER/RIGHT)}}.

In one line mode, the text can be scrolled horizontally only if the text is left aligned.


\subsubsection{Accepted characters}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:accepted-characters}}
You can set a list of accepted characters with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarae\_set\_accepted\_chars(ta, "0123456789.+-")}}.
Other characters will be ignored.


\subsubsection{Max text length}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:max-text-length}}
The maximum number of characters can be limited with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_max\_length(textarea, max\_char\_num)}}


\subsubsection{Very long texts}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:very-long-texts}}
If there is a  very long text in the Text area  (e. g. \textgreater{} 20k characters) its scrolling and drawing might be slow.
However, by enabling \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LABEL\_LONG\_TXT\_HINT   1}} in \sphinxstyleemphasis{lv\_conf.h} it can be hugely improved.
It will save some info about the label to speed up its drawing.
Using \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_LABEL\_LONG\_TXT\_HINT}} the scrolling and drawing will as fast as with "normal" short texts.


\subsubsection{Select text}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:select-text}}
A part of text can be selected if enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_text\_sel(textarea, true)}}.
It works like when you select a text on your PC with your mouse.


\subsubsection{Scrollbars}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:scrollbars}}
The scrollbars can shown according to different policies set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_textarea\_set\_sb\_mode(textarea, LV\_SCRLBAR\_MODE\_...)}}.
Learn more at the {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} object.


\subsubsection{Scroll propagation}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:scroll-propagation}}
When the Text area is scrolled on an other scrollable object (like a Page) and the scrolling has reached the edge of the Text area, the scrolling can be propagated to the parent.
In other words, when the Text area can be scrolled further, the parent will be scrolled instead.

It can be enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_scroll\_propagation(ta, true)}}.

Learn more at the {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} object.


\subsubsection{Edge flash}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:edge-flash}}
When the Text area is scrolled to edge a circle like flash animation can be shown if it is enabled with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_edge\_flash(ta, true)}}


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Slider:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_INSERT} Sent when a character before a character is inserted.
The evnet data is the text planned to insert. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ta\_set\_insert\_replace(ta, "New text")}} replaces the text to insert.
The new text can't be in a local variable which is destroyed when the event callback exists. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{""}} means do not insert anything.

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} When the content of the text area has been changed.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/textarea:keys}}\begin{itemize}
\item {}

\section{Tile view (lv\_tileview)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:tile-view-lv-tileview}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:overview}}
The Tileview is a container object where its elements (called \sphinxstyleemphasis{tiles}) can be arranged in a grid form.
By swiping the user can navigate between the tiles.

If the Tileview is screen sized it gives a user interface you might have seen on the smartwatches.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:parts-and-styles}}
The Tileview has the same parts as {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}}.
Expect \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_PAGE\_PART\_SCRL}} because it can't be referenced and it's always transparent.
Refer the Page's documentation of details.


\subsection{Usage}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:usage}}

\subsubsection{Valid positions}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:valid-positions}}
The tiles don't have to form a full grid where every element exists.
There can be holes in the grid but it has to be continuous, i.e. there can't be an empty rows or columns.

With \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_valid\_positions(tileview, valid\_pos\_array, array\_len)}} the valid positions can be set.
Scrolling will be possible only to this positions.
The \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{0,0}} index means the top left tile.
E.g. \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_point\_t valid\_pos\_array{[}{]} = \{\{0,0\}, \{0,1\}, \{1,1\}, \{\{LV\_COORD\_MIN, LV\_COORD\_MIN\}\}}} gives a Tile view with "L" shape.
It indicates that there is no tile in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{1,1\}}} therefore the user can't scroll there.

In other words, the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{valid\_pos\_array}} tells where the tiles are.
It can be changed on the fly to disable some positions on specific tiles.
For example, there can be a 2x2 grid where all tiles are added but the first row (y = 0) as a  "main row" and the second row (y = 1) contains options for the tile above it.
Let's say horizontal scrolling is possible only in the main row and not possible between the options in the second row. In this case the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{valid\_pos\_array}} needs to changed when a new main tile is selected:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
for the first main tile: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{0,0\}, \{0,1\}, \{1,0\}}} to disable the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{1,1\}}} option tile

\item {} 
for the second main tile \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{0,0\}, \{1,0\}, \{1,1\}}} to disable the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{\{0,1\}}} option tile

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Set tile}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:set-tile}}
To set the currently visible tile use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_tile\_act(tileview, x\_id, y\_id, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}.


\subsubsection{Add element}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:add-element}}
To add elements just create an object on the Tileview and position it manually to the desired position.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_add\_element(tielview, element)}} should be used to make possible to scroll (drag) the Tileview by one its element.
For example, if there is a button on a tile, the button needs to be explicitly added to the Tileview to enable the user to scroll the Tileview with the button too.


\subsubsection{Scroll propagation}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:scroll-propagation}}
The scroll propagation feature of page-like objects (like {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/list::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{List}}}}) can be used very well here.
For example, there can be a full-sized List and when it reaches the top or bottom most position the user will scroll the tile view instead.


\subsubsection{Animation time}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:animation-time}}
The animation time of the Tileview can be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_anim\_time(tileview, anim\_time)}}.

Animations are applied when
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
a new tile is selected with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_tile\_act}}

\item {} 
the current tile is scrolled a little and then released (revert the original title)

\item {} 
the current tile is scrolled more than half size and then released (move to the next tile)

\end{itemize}


\subsubsection{Edge flash}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:edge-flash}}
An "edge flash" effect can be added when the tile view reached hits an invalid position or the end of tile view when scrolled.

Use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_edge\_flash(tileview, true)}} to enable this feature.


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:events}}
Besides the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} the following \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#special-events}{Special events} are sent by the Slider:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_EVENT\_VALUE\_CHANGED} Sent when a new tile loaded either with scrolling or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_tileview\_set\_act}}. The event data is set ti the index of the new tile in \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{valid\_pos\_array}} (It's type is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{uint32\_t *}})

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:keys}}\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_UP}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT} Increment the slider's value by 1

\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_DOWN}, \sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_LEFT} Decrement the slider's value by 1

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\subsection{Example}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/tileview:example}}

\subsubsection{C}

\section{Window (lv\_win)}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:window-lv-win}}\label{\detokenize{widgets/win::doc}}

\subsection{Overview}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:overview}}
The Window is container-like objects built from a header with title and button and a content area.


\subsection{Parts and Styles}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:parts-and-styles}}
The main part is \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_WIN\_PART\_BG}} which holds the two other real parts:
\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_WIN\_PART\_HEADER}}: a header {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/cont::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Container}}}} on the top with a title and control buttons

\item {} 
\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_WIN\_PART\_CONTENT\_SCRL}} the scrollable part of a {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} for the content below the header.

\end{enumerate}

Besides these, \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_WIN\_PART\_CONTENT\_SCRL}} has a scrollbar part called \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{LV\_WIN\_PART\_CONTENT\_SCRL}}.
Read the documentation of {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} for more details on the scrollbars.

All parts supports the typical background properties. The title uses the \sphinxstyleemphasis{Text} properties of the header part.

The height of the control buttons is: \sphinxstyleemphasis{header height - header padding\_top -  header padding\_bottom}.


\subsubsection{Title}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:title}}
On the header, there is a title which can be modified by: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_title(win, "New title")}}.


\subsubsection{Control buttons}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:control-buttons}}
Control buttons can be added to the right of the window header with: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_add\_btn\_right(win, LV\_SYMBOL\_CLOSE)}}, to add a button to the left side of the window header use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_add\_btn\_left(win, LV\_SYMBOL\_CLOSE)}} instead.
The second parameter is an {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/img::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Image}}}} source so it can be a symbol, a pointer to an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_img\_dsc\_t }}variable or a path to file.

The width of the buttons can be set with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_btn\_width(win, w)}}. If \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{w == 0}} the buttons will be square-shaped.

\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_close\_event\_cb}} can be used as an event callback to close the Window.


\subsubsection{Scrollbars}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:scrollbars}}
The scrollbar behavior can be set by \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_scrlbar\_mode(win, LV\_SCRLBAR\_MODE\_...)}}.
See {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/page::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Page}}}} for details.


\subsubsection{Manual scroll and focus}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:manual-scroll-and-focus}}
To scroll the Window directly you can use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_scroll\_hor(win, dist\_px)}} or \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_scroll\_ver(win, dist\_px)}}.

To make the Window show an object on it use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_focus(win, child, LV\_ANIM\_ON/OFF)}}.

The time of scroll and focus animations can  be adjusted with \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_anim\_time(win, anim\_time\_ms)}}


\subsubsection{Layout}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:layout}}
To set a layout for the content use \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_win\_set\_layout(win, LV\_LAYOUT\_...)}}.
See {\hyperref[\detokenize{widgets/cont::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Container}}}} for details.


\subsection{Events}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:events}}
Only the \sphinxhref{/overview/event.html\#generic-events}{Generic events} are sent by the object type.

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/event::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Events}}}}.


\subsection{Keys}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:keys}}
The following \sphinxstyleemphasis{Keys} are processed by the Page:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
\sphinxstylestrong{LV\_KEY\_RIGHT/LEFT/UP/DOWN} Scroll the page

\end{itemize}

Learn more about {\hyperref[\detokenize{overview/indev::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Keys}}}}.


\subsection{Example}
\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:example}}

\label{\detokenize{widgets/win:c}}

\chapter{Contributing}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:contributing}}\label{\detokenize{contrib/index::doc}}

\section{Introduction}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:introduction}}
Join LVGL's community and leave your footprint in library!

There are lot of ways to contribute to LVGL even if your are new to library or even new to programming.

It might be scary to make the first step but you have nothing to afraid of.
A friendly and helpful community is waiting to know like minded people and make something great together.

So let's find which contribution option fits you the best and join the development of LVGL!

Before getting started here are some guidelines to make contribution smoother:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Be kind and friendly.

\item {} 
Be sure to read the relevant part of the documentation before posting a question.

\item {} 
Ask questions in \sphinxhref{https://forum.lvgl.io/}{Forum} and use {[}GitHub{]}((https://github.com/lvgl/) for development-related discussions.

\item {} 
Fill the post or issue templates in the Forum or GitHub. It makes much easier to understand your case and you will get a useful answer faster.

\item {} 
If possible send an absolute minimal but build-able code example in order to reproduce the issue. Be sure it contains all required the variable declarations, constants and assets (images, fonts).

\item {} 
Use \sphinxhref{https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet}{Markdown} to format your posts. You can learn it in 10 minutes.

\item {} 
Speak about one thing in one issue or topic.

\item {} 
Give feedback and close the issue or mark the topic as solved if your question is answered.

\item {} 
For non-trivial fixes and features it's better open an issue first to discuss the details instead of sending a pull request directly.

\item {} 
Please read and follow the \sphinxhref{https://github.com/lvgl/lvgl/blob/master/docs/CODING\_STYLE}{Coding style} guide.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{DCO}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:dco}}

\subsection{Pull request}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:pull-request}}
Merging new code into lvgl, documentation, blog, examples and other repositories happens via \sphinxstyleemphasis{Pull requests} (PR for short).
A PR is a notification like "Hey, I made some updates to your project. Here are the changes, you can added them if you want.*
To do this you need a copy (called fork) of the original project under your account, make some changes there, and notify the original repository about your updates.
You can see how it looks like on GitHub for lvgl here: https://github.com/lvgl/lvgl/pulls

To add your changes you can edit files online on GitHub and send a new Pull request from there (recommended for small changes) or
add the updates in your favorite editor/IDE and use git to publish the changes (recommended for more complex updates).


\subsubsection{From GitHub}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:from-github}}\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
Navigate to the file you want to edit.

\item {} 
Click the Edit button in the top right-hand corner.

\item {} 
Add your changes to the file

\item {} 
Add a commit message on the bottom of the page

\item {} 
Click the \sphinxstyleemphasis{Propose changes} button

\end{enumerate}


\subsubsection{From command line}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:from-command-line}}
It's about the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lvgl}} repository but it works the same way for other repositories too.
\begin{enumerate}
\def\theenumi{\arabic{enumi}}
\def\labelenumi{\theenumi .}
\makeatletter\def\p@enumii{\p@enumi \theenumi .}\makeatother
\item {} 
Fork the \sphinxhref{https://github.com/lvgl/lvgl}{lvgl repository}. To do this click the "Fork" button in the top right corner.
It will "copy" the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lvgl}} repository to your GitHub account (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{https://github.com/\textless{}YOUR\_NAME\textgreater{}?tab=repositories}})

\item {} 
Clone  your forked repository.

\item {} 
Add your changes. You can create a \sphinxstyleemphasis{feature branch} from \sphinxstyleemphasis{master} for the updates: \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{git checkout -b the-new-feature}}

\item {} 
Commit and push you changed to the forked \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lvgl}} repository.

\item {} 
Create a PR on GitHub from the page of your \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lvgl}} repository (\sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{https://github.com/\textless{}YOUR\_NAME\textgreater{}/lvgl}}) by clicking the \sphinxstyleemphasis{"New pull request"} button. Don't forget to select the branch where you added your changes.

\item {} 
Set the base branch. It means where you want to merge your update. In the \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lvgl}} repo fixes go to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{master}}, new features to \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{dev}} branch.

\item {} 
Describe what is in the update. An example code is welcome if applicable.

\item {} 
Update** your \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lvgl}} repo with new commits. They will automatically appear in the PR too.

\end{enumerate}


\section{When you got started with LVGL}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:when-you-got-started-with-lvgl}}
Even if you're just got started with LVGL there plenty of ways to make your feet wet. Most of these options even doesn't required to know a single line of code of LVGL.


\subsection{Give LVGL a Star}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:give-lvgl-a-star}}
Show that you like LVGL by giving it star on GitHub!







Star

This simple click makes LVGL more visible on GitHub and makes it more attractive to other people.
So with this you already helped a lot!


\subsection{Tell what you have achieved}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:tell-what-you-have-achieved}}
Have you already started LVGL in a {\hyperref[\detokenize{get-started/pc-simulator::doc}]{\sphinxcrossref{\DUrole{doc,doc,doc}{Simulator}}}}, a development board or you custom hardware?
Was it easy or where there some obstacles? Are you happy with the result?

If so why don't you tell it to your friends? You can post it on Twitter, Facebook, LinkedIn or create a YouTube video.

Any of these helps a lot to spread the word of LVGL and familiarize it with new developers.

Only thing: don't forget to add a link to https://lvg.io or https://github.com/lvgl and \#lvgl. Thank you! :)


\subsection{Write examples}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:write-examples}}
As you learn LVGL probably you will play with the features of widgets. But why don't you publish your experiments?

Every widgets' documentation contains some examples. For example here are the examples of the \sphinxhref{/widgets/dropdown.html\#example}{Drop-down list}.
The examples are directly loaded from the \sphinxhref{https://github.com/lvgl/lv\_examples/tree/master/src/lv\_ex\_widgets}{lv\_examples} repository.

So all you need to do is sending a \sphinxhref{/contributing/index.html\#pull-request}{Pull request} to the \sphinxhref{https://github.com/lvgl/lv\_examples/tree/master/src/lv\_ex\_widgets}{lv\_examples} repository and follow some conventions:
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Name the examples like \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{lv\_ex\_\textless{}widget\_name\textgreater{}\_\textless{}id\textgreater{}}}

\item {} 
Make the example as short and simple as possible

\item {} 
Add comments to explain what the example does

\item {} 
Use 320x240 resolution

\item {} 
Create a screenshot about the example

\item {} 
Update \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{index.rst}} in the example's folder with your new example. See how the other example are added.

\end{itemize}


\subsection{Improve the docs}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:improve-the-docs}}
As you read the documentation you might see some typos or unclear sentences.
For typos and straightforward fixes you can simply edit the file on GitHub. There is an \sphinxcode{\sphinxupquote{Edit on Github}} link on the top right-hand corner of all page.
Click it to see the file on GitHub, hit the Edit button and add you fixes as described in \sphinxhref{/contributing/index.html\#from-github}{Pull request - From GitHub} section.

Note that, the documentation is also formatted in \sphinxhref{https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/wiki/Markdown-Cheatsheet}{Markdown}.


\subsection{Translate the docs}
\label{\detokenize{contrib/index:translate-the-docs}}
If you have more free time you can even translate the documentation. If your chosen language is still not added, please write a post
\begin{itemize}
\item {} 
Get started section

\item {} 
Overview : Objects, Events, Styles

\item {} 
Porting: System overview, Set-up a project, Display interface, Input device Interface, Tick interface

\item {} 
5 widgets of your choice

\end{itemize}
